text: what would you do if you were told you
have only three months to live cordula
vulcanic who was recently diagnosed with
terminal brain cancer has decided to
spend at painting and she has been going
at it like a woman possessed i I stay in
the moment is not passed or not a future
and stay in the present is keeping me
sane cordula is a 52 year old mother of
two from Brooklyn a german-born art
student she worked doing interior
construction design until the cancer
came now she says the only way she can
keep a measure of sanity and happiness
is by returning to her old passion so
she's devoting her remaining days to
painting with no real savings she had to
give up her apartment and took a room
with relatives and rented this studio
space in Brooklyn the tumors have
impaired her speech and sometimes she
has to scribble words down just to
communicate she paints rapidly and
spontaneously and her images of primal
and powerful not only is she painting
for her present state of mind but also
for her children's future she has
finished dozens of paintings and has
already had three art shows and sold
enough of her work to raise $25,000 for
her children life insurance can take
place have a college and the quest of it
that money is spending all the money on
you my kids after a year of ineffective
surgeries and chemotherapy treatments
cordula has now given up on medical
treatment after being told that it would
give her some more time but leave her
too weak to paint she says the terminal
illness has simplified things washing
away the worry and petty preoccupations
that almost made life more difficult
when she had plenty of it and she has
never felt more connected to the canvas
and to her creativity hi I nothing to
lose
and that the paintings are a gift for me
